info.game_comments: (Sarah: Hi, I'm Sarah of the Clue Crew.  We're coming to you today from the set of Men in Black II.  You know, for some reason, we like Agent Jay best.)

(1, 1).clue: (Sarah is behind the scenes of Men in Black II.) The tagline of "Men in Black" was "Protecting the earth from" this

(2, 1).clue: More than 90% of the population in the Middle East follows this religion

(3, 1).clue: Rita Wilson worked with him filming "Volunteers" in 1985 & volunteered to marry him 3 years later

(4, 1).clue: It has its own "call" & you "ring it down" to end the play

(5, 1).clue: It was enacted in the U.S. to save energy in World War I but farmers forced its repeal a year later in 1919

(6, 1).clue: Rolling Stone has an encyclopedia covering it

(1, 2).clue: Women in the "Men in Black" films include Lara Flynn Boyle & this "Last Seduction" star

(2, 2).clue: This Palestinian leader's first name is Arabic for "easy-going"

(3, 2).clue: Hal Holbrook had designs on this "Designing Woman" in 1984; hope they'll never need "Family Law" to break it up

(4, 2).clue: If your parents were in the theater, as well as you, it's said that you were born in one of these

(5, 2).clue: A famous one of these was torpedo-shaped & buried at a depth of 50 feet at Flushing Meadows, N.Y. in 1938

(6, 2).clue: Last name of Puff the Magic Dragon's friend Jackie

(3, 3).clue: This producer got "Up Close and Personal" with Michelle Pfeiffer in 1993

(4, 3).clue: It's the term for a song in a musical that gets big applause, causing a pause in the performance

(1, 4).clue: Featured in "Men in Black" parts 1 & 2, Frank is this type of dog, also slang for a prizefighter

(2, 4).clue: This Hashemite kingdom's only port is Al-Aqaba on the Gulf of Aqaba

(3, 4).clue: Before Nicole Kidman, Tom Cruise was married to this actress

(4, 4).clue: When acting in the theater, it's said that you tread these

(5, 4).clue: If it's 5:00 p.m., Friday, on the west side of the International Date Line, it's this day & time on the east side

(6, 4).clue: It's what you're "hanging" when passing bad checks

(1, 5).clue: (Sarah is behind the scenes of Men in Black II.) This director of the "Men in Black" movies also directed Will Smith in "Wild Wild West"

(2, 5).clue: In 1968 this political party sent its opponents to the shower & has been ruling Iraq since then

(3, 5).clue: The actress born Mary Beth Supinger married this Oscar-winning actor

(4, 5).clue: Term for the forestage, the part closest to the audience

(5, 5).clue: This calendar devised around 45 B.C. was used by western nations for over 1,500 years

(6, 5).clue: The Dungeness is a large species of this type of crab

(1, 1).clue: In 905 the Kokinshu, an anthology of poetry in the waka form, was compiled in this country

(2, 1).clue: Where heart patients are treated: CCU

(3, 1).clue: The phenomenon seen here is a combination of these 2 words

(4, 1).clue: A series of rabies shots followed his biting the head off a bat during a concert in 1981

(5, 1).clue: The "Big 3" dailies in France are Liberation, Le Figaro & this, meaning "The World"

(6, 1).clue: His first name was actually Gaius & he was one-third of the First Triumvirate

(1, 2).clue: This "Road Not Taken" poet was named by his parents for Robert E. Lee

(2, 2).clue: What Jerry's Kids are hoping to find a cure for: MD

(4, 2).clue: On this group's second album, 2000's "Mad Season", the 20 in its name was spelled out

(5, 2).clue: The first paper published in a Native American language was one in this language in Georgia in 1828

(6, 2).clue: Octavius, later known as Augustus, was the first Caesar to be an imperator, or as we know it, this

(2, 3).clue: Typists & computer users are prone to it: CTS
